intro: Ceropegia swazica, commonly known as the Swaziland milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is typical of many species in its family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky surfaces or in sandy soils. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
